intro: Hieracium filiare, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium filiare is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
